title: VPMOVM2B/VPMOVM2W/VPMOVM2D/VPMOVM2Q — Convert a Mask Register to a Vector Register

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPMOVM2B xmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2B ymm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2B zmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2W xmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2W ymm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2W zmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2D xmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2D ymm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2D zmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2Q xmm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2Q ymm1, k1`
`VPMOVM2Q zmm1, k1`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Converts a mask register to a vector register. Each element in the destination register is set to all 1’s or all 0’s depending on the value of the corresponding bit in the source mask register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a mask register. The destination operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
